title: AI for Dynamic Spectrum Sharing (DSS)
summary: Could AI dramatically change how DSS works? Radio spectrum is pricey. Operators drop billions at auction to lock down licensed frequency bands, and every single frequency counts. title: Can 6G finally answer the question of reliable indoor connectivity once and for all? (Reader Forum)
summary: Not likely — but Wi-Fi offload might The 6G network is coming, and the telecommunications industry has no shortage of ambition: higher performance, “implantables,” tighter integration with AI, and increasingly seamless connectivity across environments. And yet, one of the most persistent challenges in mobile networks remains unresolved: reliable indoor connectivity. This isn’t a new problem, nor […]

summary: Neocloud player Crusoe is moving beyond raw GPUs to abstract away even more tricky AI infrastructure decisions as deployments ramp.

title: Solving the hidden complexities of Open RAN (Reader Forum)
summary: Deploying and operating Open RAN environments is far more complex than the vision suggests Open RAN (Radio Access Network) has been heralded as a breakthrough for mobile operators, promising flexibility, innovation, and vendor diversity by disaggregating hardware and software into open, interoperable components. In theory, it’s a revolution. In practice, it’s a minefield. The reality […]

title: Arrcus bets on a smarter network fabric for AI inference
summary: Arrcus is betting that incumbents like Cisco, Arista, HPE/Juniper, and F5 will be slow to pivot their existing product lines toward a policy-aware inference fabric architecture, Roy Chua of AvidThink told Fierce Network.

summary: 5G Americas, the North American-based industry association, is closing up operations at the end February 2026.

title: Dell'Oro: RAN market stabilized in late 2025
